measured_by: novel-pair testing trials in the multi-day reward learning task
justification: “Critically, the multi-session design allowed us to assess the formation of absolute values by asking subjects to choose between images that were never directly paired together during learning.”

measured_by: rank bias in choices between similarly rewarded images
justification: “Examining subjects' choices between similarly rewarded images from low-concurrent-diversity conditions showed that subjects indeed preferred images that ranked higher during learning.”

measured_by: accuracy drop between learnt-pair and novel-pair testing trials
justification: “We compared subjects' accuracy on these trials to accuracy in choosing between images that subjects had encountered during learning ('learnt-pair' testing trials)… this result shows that subjects generalized their preferences well, but did not do so perfectly.”

measured_by: Bayesian logistic mixed model coefficients for ‘other images’ reward history
justification: “To control for this confound, we used a Bayesian logistic mixed model that predicted subjects' choices … and the reward history from trials in which the currently available images were rejected in favor of any other image. Importantly, only the latter regressor unequivocally captures the effect of other images' outcomes.”
construct: Influence of other options' outcomes on choice
